snippet.textDisplay:
Thank you everyone for worrying about demonetization. Thanks to our patrons (high five!) and our sponsors (Go to http://Brilliant.org/SciShow to try out Brilliant’s Daily Challenges. The first 200 subscribers get 20% off an annual Premium subscription.) we don't ever have to worry about whether any individual video is going to get demonetized. Obviously, even if we did, we would still cover topics like this, but it is nice to not have it even enter our minds. Honestly, the subject of whether this video would be monetized literally never came up in the office and that's entirely because of Patreon, so thank you for your support.

And now I'm gonna go wash my hands now because I just high fived a bunch of people.

- Hank

snippet.textDisplay:
I wish a science show would give a detailed account of the corona virus- 'covid 19' 's life cycle and spread patterns, seeing as we first learned of it last year (nearly 4 months ago) and only after it had already been identified and suppressed by The Chinese Government and a media blackout! It took a Chinese doctor to whistle blower via online social media before the alarm was raised, we the dillied and dallied for nearly a month before any real quarantines were enforced giving covid 19 the opportunity to create at least 3 new generations of infection through the 14 day incubation cycle most commonly reported and go round the world twice over!
After four months there has been time to get 9 to 10 generations spread and with a virulent virus that is easily transmittable we should have seen cases in just about every airport in the world withing days of the whistle blowers blog! yet its only been the last 2 weeks that's 3 months after revelation, that we are seeing outbreaks around the world. That does not fit the life cycles or spread patterns of any single out break of any virus including Spanish flue and N1B1 bird flue! IT IS A HOAX OR WE HAVE BEEN LIED TO ABOUT IT AND ITS SOURCE! plus 18 million people in north Italy quarantined yet the only accounts of this is Sanitised MSM perspectives with a reputation to lie to the public for sensationalism! NOT ONE SINGLE INDEPENDENT ITALIAN BLOGGER when we live and breath social media like a drug! Makes no sense that no one thought to make a few advert coin from the odd video!

snippet.textDisplay: The news is making it really hard to be calm and informed about this whole situation and it's really frustrating, so thanks for the update!
snippet.textOriginal: The news is making it really hard to be calm and informed about this whole situation and it's really frustrating, so thanks for the update!

snippet.textDisplay:
Dear worried Americans! I’m a Korean. Yes, I’m living in Korea where every person is fighting against the fear of infection. Yes again, I’m losing many enjoyable things and I feel like I’m on pins and needles whenever the authorities try to tell the updated virus stories. So do many fellow Koreans I bet. But things are not all that bad because I can see a ray of hope that some optimistic factors start to show up recently. Kinda turning point? Yes, it may be. Anyway me and many of my fellow Koreans are monitoring the situation closely. What news will be appear on the next news?!!.

When it comes to the Covid 19, I think the situation in the United States is somewhat different from those in other countries. In Korea, for example, even though it now ranked the 2nd for the
number of confirmed patients, experts forecast not so pessimistic as the number begins to slow down thru painstaking efforts from both the government and individuals. Notably, the speed of diagnosis is superb.

It's true that nearly all Koreans have public health insurance, but not the United States, and I think this is the most important reason why Americans should initiate much stronger action to take.
What if when lots of Americans without medical insurance get asymptomatic corona and they simply think of it as a mere cold? Are they going to go direct consulting or headway to hospital? I had been in the U.S for a couple of years and I can say NO, Many of them will ignore it or take medicine instead. It is too obvious that they will be the fast carriers of the corona virus. By all means, Americans have to take every action to prevent the spread of corona in the U.S. Corona situation is more horrible than you can imagine.

Of course, prevention is the best way. But things has gone to far. In Korea, they had done so well until a cult religious group named Shinchunji (means the New World) produced the first patient. And things has been changed overnight. Korean government had overlooked the fact that in places with high virus density, just one infected person can instantly infect everyone around them. So, we need cutting off all rings of the infection. That’s why social distancing and personal hygiene are vital rules to obey.

I think, in administrative level, if symptoms are suspected, they should be diagnosed ASAP. OMG, it needs to build a special budget to do the job at a lowest cost or hopefully for free. I wonder if American law makers can pass such a revolutionary bill. In addition, speeding up the diagnosis is urgent. It’s war of time. Of course, you need transparent disclosure of medical information about the confirmed, statistics and relevant policies overall. Silence leads us to disaster.

When the Covid 19 turns out to be pandemic in the US, the economies of the world will be truly appalling. Numerous hell gates will open to the world. This is what I'm really worried about. Please
listen carefully to the experts and call for more practical ways to the concerned. Way to go, Americans! Not much time is left! Are you ready for being daredevil fighters against against this  virus war?

snippet.textDisplay:
Just a thought and a feeling:
I don't know if it's just me, but the sound in the video is not very comfortable to hear. I would prefer if it was milder, maybe a little bit less of the high uncomfortable sound. I can hear it a lot in youtube videos, but if you listen to other shows (for example: Last Week Tonight with John Oliver) the sound there is more comfortable to hear, and to concentrate on for a longer time period.


Anyways, have a nice day ^.^

snippet.textDisplay: I don’t think it’s a good idea to say masks are useless or that it’s only for the sick, it makes people less willing to wear masks as they don’t want to get stigmatised. In Hong Kong, everyone expected people to wear masks sick or not and won’t see them as sick people. I do think wearing mask for majority of populations is one of the reason why Hong Kong cases didn’t explode like in Europe. Also the massive outbreak in the Korea is because the cult gathering don’t let people wear masks. There are no solid evidence showing that masks are useless, and its not hard to not touching the mask surface when disposing, also surgical masks aren't high tech machinery that are difficult to make, Hong Kong just started making their own, so why not wear it?

snippet.textDisplay: The problem with the Coronavirus is their is no vaccine!  As you know, viruses can go dormant!  So, if one person contracts the Coronavirus and does not show any symptoms, they maybe a carrier!  A carrier with a dormant virus could go months without activation, then all of sudden, the virus is activated under the right health conditions!  Once activated, contamination follows, thus the spreads continues again!  Also, do not know if the virus ever leaves the person once contracted, again we are back to a dormant virus situation!   All viruses have a ability to change their DNA strand over time!  Influenza is famous for this!  🇨🇦😊

snippet.textDisplay: Basically, a pandemic vs epidemic decides wether we give up and let it run its course. Compared to the middle ages with the plague, in modern times with modern medicine, leaving a disease alone could probably limit the number of deaths more than if we continue to poke and prod at it. That's what a pandemic means. It means we stop poking and prodding. I vote that we stop. It's a very polite virus. And yes, I'm benevolent towards diseases. #covidpandemic

snippet.textDisplay: Not enough testing capability in the US means we really have no clue how widespread it is here. The current confirmed cases number is pretty much meaningless in the USA, and so therefore so are the mortality numbers. I think this is both good and bad: it means that it's probably less deadly than initial data suggests but also means that there's probably a lot more people infected than we know about. Just my opinion.
snippet.textOriginal: Not enough testing capability in the US means we really have no clue how widespread it is here. The current confirmed cases number is pretty much meaningless in the USA, and so therefore so are the mortality numbers. I think this is both good and bad: it means that it's probably less deadly than initial data suggests but also means that there's probably a lot more people infected than we know about. snippet.textDisplay: On one hand, everyone should keep their hands clean (should be doing that anyway, Nasty) & stop panicking. On the other hand, nothing would hasten a National Health Service or true "Medicare-For-All" like a rampant pandemic wreaking havoc on an already overworked & under-insured population.

snippet.textDisplay: I’m a layman with an uneducated guess, but I kind of feel like we wont be able to contain this effectively pretty soon. I would not he surprised if we switched to the “pandemic” mitigation approach
snippet.textOriginal: I’m a layman with an uneducated guess, but I kind of feel like we wont be able to contain this effectively pretty soon. I would not he surprised if we switched to the “pandemic” mitigation approach

snippet.textDisplay: Cases in China are NOT slowing.  China just redefined how they classify the disease and they are not identifying lots of cases and burning the bodies so nobody can test.  Funny how you can just manipulate the numbers that easily.  The U.S. decided to just focus on mitigation. We are not testing nor quarantining enough to take this seriously.  The BIG tell on COVID19 is shortness of breath.
